cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi (25 km) south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW today, then turning northwest toward the north-western Gulf of Mexico and the Texas-Louisiana coast by late Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the Texas-Louisiana border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Storm Surge Watches expected later today for portions of the northwest Gulf Coast (TX-LA shoreline).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings currently in effect for Little Cayman, Cayman Brac, much of Cuba, and the lower Florida Keys.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuban south coast, Florida Keys, and forecast to impact the northwest Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana mid-week.
weather_observation.wind: Remnant low may bring occasional gusts 20–30 mph as it passes south-east of Kansas City late Friday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Possible 1–3 inches of rain late Friday into Saturday, enough for ponding on terminal yards but below 4-inch threshold.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor risk of localized flash-flooding in low-lying areas; no salt-water intrusion or coastal impacts.
